intro: Chamaecrista lavradioides, commonly known as the smallleaf ticktrefoil, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in wetland environments. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and the leaves are pinnately divided with a hairy texture. It plays a role in ecological systems by providing habitat and food for various insects and wildlife.
